title: HR Manager
description:
Are you looking for a career that offers personal and professional growth, flexibility, and a supportive environment? Look no further! AG Care is an innovative organization committed to investing in our employees and providing the very best care to our patients.

At AG Care our mission is to serve our community with the highest compassionate and innovative care! We are committed to building a Team of dedicated, caring, and responsible professionals, who prioritize patients’ well-being and exceptional care services. Our HR Manager is a crucial part of our mission with their primary responsibilities to make decisions and address specific tasks in the best way possible, implement HR strategies, and facilitate the overall goals of the company.

**Responsibilities:**

* Oversee the entire recruitment process, from onboarding to offboarding.
* Implement and develop HR strategies aligned with the organization’s business objectives and values.
* Evaluate employee’s needs for training, professional development and educational needs.
* Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations.
* Conduct workplace investigations, disciplinary actions, and termination procedures with fairness and transparency.
* Develop, implement, and communicate HR policies and procedures.
* Manage employee relations by addressing concerns, grievances, and other sensitive issues in a professional and confidential manner.
* Collaborate with leadership to design and implement compensation, benefits, and performance management systems.
* Lead initiatives to enhance employee engagement, retention, and workplace culture.
* Provide HR guidance and support to management and staff on all human resource-related matters.
* Ensure HR systems and processes are optimized and scalable as the organization grows.
* Promote diversity, equity, and inclusion across the organization.
* Partner with external stakeholders, such as legal counsel, recruitment agencies, and employee benefits providers, as needed.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as an HR Manager (Healthcare Industry or related field is preferred).
* Strong Communication Skills.
* Excellent Leadership Skills.
* Strong Organizational Skills.
* Ability to adapt in a fast-paced and evolving environment, with a solution-oriented mindset.
* In-depth knowledge of employment laws, HR best practices, and regulatory requirements.
* A Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
* HR certification (e.g., PHR, SPHR, SHRM-CP, SHRM-SCP) is strongly preferred.

title: Accounts Payable Analyst
description:
**Accounts Payable Analyst**

Put your career into high gear with Mavis Discount Tire! We're looking for a full time Accounts Payable Analyst to join Team Mavis at our Operations Support Center in White Plains, NY. With over 2,000 retail locations, Mavis is one of the largest tire sales and automotive repair chains in the United States, and we’re growing rapidly.

**About the Position of Accounts Payable Analyst**

The Accounts Payable Analyst is responsible for reviewing statements, invoices and reviewing monthly expenses for all our vendors. The job of an A/P Analyst is to ensure all bills are paid on time and accurately.

**Qualifications**

* be at least 18 years of age.
* be legally authorized to work in the United States;
* have phone skills to be able to work with vendors as well as internal staff from other departments.
* Must have moderate to advanced skills with Excel.
* Knowledge of Macro’s is a plus.
* 2 years of experience with accounts payable and statement reconciliation preferred.
* Must be self-motivated, organized, and dependable.

**Requirements**

* Review invoices and credits that are entered into our system to ensure the correct coding and authorization exist.
* Reconciliation of several large statements both weekly and monthly.
* Prepare payments for large vendors based on statements as well as ensuring discounts are taken timely.
* Handle incoming phone calls from vendors and internal departments.
* Creating accurate daily, weekly and monthly payment proposals with discount information available.
* Communicate missing invoice lists with respective departments to ensure payments are made on time and in full.
* Complete ad-hoc vendor audits

**Employee Benefits**

*At Ma*vis, we understand that our people drive our success. We provide our team members with competitive weekly pay, a good working environment and an excellent combination of additional benefits like health, dental, vision and life insurance, a 401(k) retirement savings plan with employer match, paid vacations, paid personal and sick time, paid holidays, on-the-job training, and opportunities for career growth and advancement.

title: Computer Room Operator
description:
**Position Summary**

The Computer Room Operator position will assist the production operation team by completing tasks for the Bank’s mainframe computer system, and take responsibility for the design and development of the bank’s documentation. A successful candidate will be proficient and well versed in testing, developing and running software programs as needed to support the banks **on premise** processing center. This candidate must also have strong knowledge of back-end branch banking processing procedures to ensure timely completion of branch production capture.

**Essential Functions**

* Performs data processing operations according to business production schedule(s)
* Process and balance various incoming and outgoing files from branches, payroll customers, Federal Reserve and Remote Deposit customers ACH files
* Identifies and corrects file and system errors as they occur
* Prints and prepares daily, monthly and quarterly reports and special forms for end user consumption
* Maintains and manages routine backup procedures to reduce the risk of data loss
* Collaborate with programmers and or systems analyst to coordinate testing environments and system problems
* Documents and updates procedural manuals as needed
* Maintains and manages processing logs
* Documents and escalates system failures, reporting on causes and corrective actions taken or to be taken
* Interfaces with third party companies for upgrades and day-to-day support needs

**Job Requirements and Qualifications**

* Familiarity with Fiserv Core processing on Unisys hardware a plus
* Shift hours that cover regular processing day (6:00am – 8:00pm)
* Occasional additional hours required to cover exceptions (24/7 operation)
* Ability to be flexible and dependable
* Detailed oriented and client focused
* Ability to act independently and work autonomously
* Job requires developing constructive and cooperative relationships with others
* Job requires honesty, integrity, and ethical behavior
* Job requires a willingness to take on responsibility and challenges
* Job requires ability to manage multiple demands and priorities

**Education and Experience**

* Associate’s degree or equivalent experience
* Experience in a banking production environment a plus

**Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

· Knowledge of banking products, services, and systems

· Knowledge of **on premise** banking systems and processes

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills

· Ability to collaborate and relate well to all kinds of people, build appropriate rapport and constructive, effective relationships, and use tact and diplomacy to handle situations comfortably

· Ability to think strategically and systemically

· Proficient reading, writing and mathematics skills

· Ability to communicate clearly in order to effectively convey information so that others understand and as appropriate for the needs of the audience

* Ability to manage the implementation, maintenance and support aspects for the Bank’s business clients direct deposit payroll

· Prioritize, coordinate and implement all Fiserv systems software releases

* Coordinate processing efforts with internal payroll processing team (HR and/or Finance) to ensure effortless payroll deposits on time for all employees; regardless of bank deposit or transactional pay period date

**Physical Requirements**

* Ability to sit for long periods of time up to 85% of work hours
* Ability to use hands to grasp, handle or feel
* Ability to use computer keyboard and system to enter data and process information
* Ability to read a computer screen at a close distance
* Ability to read, talk clearly so that others understand, hear, comprehend the written and spoken word, and see
* Ability to use telephone to communicate with others

**Working Conditions**

* Moderate sound as in business office with office machines, computers, and people traffic

**All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.76 - $22.42 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

* Old Bridge, NJ 08857 (Preferred)

title: Accounts Receivable Associate
description:
**SUMMARY OF JOB PURPOSE**:

The DBI team specializes in the evaluation of damaged structures. DBI’s construction experts provide independent recommendations and analysis to clients in the insurance and legal industry. Hard evidence, expertise, and accuracy drive work; communication and connection are the company’s top priorities. In a complex industry, the company’s mission is to bring clarity to every client served by DBI.

The Accounts Receivable Associate will perform detailed analysis, reconciliation of existing client accounts, manage payments, audit discrepancies and submit accurate invoices, as per DBI client specifications, and in compliance with financial policies and procedures. The team member is also responsible for research, resolution, and collection of delinquent customer accounts in an effort to maintain goals at or above forecast.

**PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES**:

* Conduct account research and audit DBI client accounts for accurate documentation prior to invoicing.
* Manage daily payments via check/wire deposits including reconciliations between billing platform and bank accounts. Analyze payments and place them into complex account statements.
* Apply payments to projects and balance accounts.
* Review monthly reports and send invoicing to clients as per DBI client specifications on a rolling billing schedule.
* Prepare reports (monthly) to assist with management of aging accounts; confer with DBI customers to resolve outstanding issues.
* Document account activity, observations, and notes into the Bill Quick Accounts Receivable accounting system.
* Manage an average of between 250-500 client files monthly.
* Strengthen and grow relationships with existing DBI clients by delivering excellent customer service in-person, by phone, and via email.
* Uphold the values of DBI Consultants and the culture espoused by Our Foundation.
* Consistently demonstrates professionalism, integrity and the highest standards of ethical behavior and professional conduct; conducts oneself in a manner that reflects favorably on the organization.
* Maintain the confidentiality of proprietary and sensitive information, exercising sound judgment and discretion in any disclosure of information related to DBI Consultants and its endeavors.
* Commits to continuous improvement and professional development for self and team members.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.

**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS**

* Associates degree in Accounting, Business Management or other related areas of academic study is required.
* One (1) to three (3) years of accounts receivable experience, preferably in the insurance industry.
* Customer focused mindset with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Accuracy and attention to detail required.
* Flexible and professional demeanor.

**SKILLS AND ABILITIES**

* High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and, particularly, Excel).
* Experience with billing software, such as Bill Quick, Accounts Receivable software, and client software programs, such as Legal X is preferred.
* Proven understanding of basic accounting principles, the collections cycle and regulations, as well as fair credit practices.
* Aptitude for numbers.
* Ability to identify and execute new or enhanced collections processes and programs.
* Comfortable translating complex data and insights into actionable recommendations to support cross-functional decision-making and reporting.
* Capability to partner and develop relationships with all levels of internal and external DBI customers.
* Ability to work under supervision.
* Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines.
* Uses critical thinking skills and is accountable.

**WORKING CONDITIONS**:  
Work is conducted primarily in an indoor office environment with protection from weather conditions and with exposure to noise typical of an office or administrative setting.

**PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS**:  
Work requires light lifting (10 – 15 lbs.), standing, walking, stooping, kneeling, reaching, fingering (keyboarding) and repetitive hand motion, grasping, talking, and hearing at normal speaking levels. Work requires visual acuity to read and prepare data and figures, transcribe words and numbers, view information on a computer terminal, read, operate office machines, and determine the accuracy and thoroughness of work.

The Accounts Receivable Associate is required to work in the DBI New York office from 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM in order to accommodate occasional meetings and work activities.

Salary req: 60k-65k

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Office

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Accounting: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Claims Compliance Specialist
description:
This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.
At AXIS, we believe that we are only as strong as our people. We strive to create an inclusive and welcoming culture where employees of all backgrounds and from all walks of life feel comfortable and empowered to be themselves. This means that we bring our whole selves to work.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for candidates taking part in the selection process.
AXIS Capital  

Claims Compliance Specialist, Claims Shared Services- Job Description
AXIS is seeking a Claims Quality Assurance and Compliance Specialist, Claims Shared Services to join our Shared Services Claims team. As a direct report to the Head of Quality Assurance and Compliance, Claims Shared Services, the successful candidate should possess the ability to support the development and execution of the North America Claims Quality Assurance and Compliance program for AXIS North America Claims. The successful candidate will promote a continuous improvement culture, support the framework, benchmarks and identify areas for improvement for compliance of AXIS North America Claims with an immediate focus on Adjuster Licensing and Medicare Compliance. The successful candidate is a results-driven team player with a can-do mindset focused on continuous improvement and will support claims compliance objectives and strategies in partnership with AXIS North America Claims Leadership and related internal stakeholders.
The successful Candidate will be responsible for:
Assisting with day-to-day management of AXIS North America Claim Quality Assurance and Compliance objectives.
Assisting and collaborating with other departments and stakeholders (e.g., Legal & Compliance, Internal Audit, Finance, North America Claims and Claims Operations etc.) to ensure that Quality Assurance and Compliance related processes are identified, created, implemented, maintained, and continuously improved.
Supporting the drafting of North America Claim Quality Assurance and Compliance policies, procedures, standards, processes, workflows, guidelines training, and other documents necessary to drive compliance initiatives for AXIS North America Claims in support of a center of excellence within NA Claim Quality Assurance and Compliance.
Collaborating with stakeholders identifying, investigating, resolving, tracking, and reporting on North America Claim Quality Assurance and Compliance matters and opportunities.
Responsible for supporting and providing operational support to document and maintain an accurate and compliant AXIS Claims Adjuster Licensing program, continuously improving, and enhancing this function to comply with, regulatory requirements and providing assistance to NA Claim handlers problem solve and source solutions with reciprocity questions and continuous education requirements.
Responsible for tracking, measuring, and reporting to internal stakeholders’ status claim adjuster licensing requirements in partnership with a third-party vendor and other management tools to assist with the effective and compliant management of adjuster licenses.
Assisting with maintenance of Medicare policies and procedures, monitoring, summarizing, tracking compliance objectives and timelines in partnership with a third-party vendor, reporting to internal stakeholders to support and provide operational support to document and maintain an accurate and compliant AXIS North America Claim Medicare reporting program.
Assisting with maintenance of SIU, Fraud reporting and other Compliance reporting and procedures as these may be required, monitoring, summarizing, tracking compliance objectives and timelines in partnership with a third-party vendor, reporting to internal stakeholders.
Responsible to gather, organize and analyze Quality Assurance and Compliance data and results to identify and report on performance, trends, and opportunities continuously striving for opportunities to improve.
Assist and support execution and delivery of monthly, quarterly, and annual dashboard reporting for Quality Assurance and Compliance metrics to drive continuous improvement, in collaboration with key Axis stakeholders.
Support and collaborate as required with Axis Claims Leadership and related internal stakeholders on training initiatives, job aids, guidelines to continuously improve claims handling quality and execution in support of team and individual professional growth and development.
Building and maintaining key relationships with internal stakeholders (e.g., Peers, Underwriting, Actuarial, various executive management leaders) and external stakeholders. (e.g., auditors, reinsurers, and vendors)
Providing input and feedback as needed to stakeholders in support of Claims business strategies and processes. May be asked to serve as a subject matter expert with respect to North America Claim Quality Assurance and Compliance matters.
Maintain effective and ongoing communication with claims department leaders and staff, internal and external business partners, insureds, claimants, agents, attorneys, other insurance companies, project team members, claims leadership, and vendors.
Assist with all other Quality Assurance and Compliance related tasks and initiatives as needed
KEY SKILLS & ABILITIES:
3-5 years of experience with P&C commercial claims or reinsurance organizations with a complex operating environment including both domestic and international operations. Quality Assurance and Compliance claim experience is an asset.
Ability to accomplish tasks in a dynamic environment with an aptitude for analyzing data and making practical and forward-looking decisions to drive success
Excellent communication skills and demonstrated ability and experience supporting strategic initiatives impacting key stakeholders and reporting to senior management
Experience working on cross functional teams, collaborating, actively participating, and delivering solutions
Strong organizational, critical thinking, problem solving, analytical, and quantitative skills including the ability to analyze and interpret financial and claims data
Proven prioritization skills with the ability to balance both the immediate needs with broader organizational strategies
The ability to issue spot and escalate issues that could present challenges to a project or the organization.
Strong conflict resolution skills to effectively deal with people with differing expectations and viewpoints
Strong knowledge of and skills in use of various software and insurance platforms and systems including Bill Review systems such as Legal Exchange and claims systems as well as Word and Excel
College and/or other degree (JD a plus)
Some travel (domestic) may be associated with this role
What we offer:
For this position, we currently expect to offer a base salary in the range of $80 -115k. Your salary offer will be based on an assessment of a variety of factors including your specific experience and work location.
In addition, you will be offered competitive target incentive compensation, with awards based on overall corporate and individual performance. On top of this, you will be eligible for a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes medical plans for you and your family, health and wellness programs, retirement plans, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, and much more.
Where this role is based in the United States of America, this role is *Exempt* for FLSA purposes.

title: Construction Specialist - Construction Quality Assurance - Data Analytics

* Discounted certifications through industry leading agencies

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere. title: Natural Gas Scheduler
description:
Castleton Commodities International is hiring a Natural Gas Scheduler in our Stamford, CT office. This position will support the scheduling requirements for the Company's natural gas and energy management services activitiesy. This is an excellent opportunity to join a best-in-class commodity merchant that provides significant exposure to the physical natural gas and power commercial teams.
Responsibilities* Performing gas scheduling functions related to accurate and timely pipeline nominations.
* Trade execution according to those strategies for the portfolio of assts under management, generation and transportation assets.
* Utilizing electronic bulletin boards to schedule product movement; monitoring and communicating pipeline operational information postings
* Monitoring and resolving volumetric discrepancies; monitoring and communicating producer supply changes.
* Managing pipeline imbalances and optimizing pipeline capacities.
* Communication with internal and external energy management clients.
* Entering and managing nomination data in an internal accounting system.
* Communicating pipeline tariff rate changes.
* Reviewing and approving pipeline transportation and storage invoices.
* Acting as a liaison with settlements team on pipeline and storage invoice reconciliation as well as other duties as assigned or required.
* This position requires working before/after regular office hours including some work on holidays and/or weekends

  

Required Experience:* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Engineering or related field.
* 5-7 years Minimum 2+ years progressive experience scheduling natural gas is preferred.
* Prior experience scheduling Northeast pipes strongly preferred.
* Thorough understanding of natural gas grid, gas flow, and transport segmentation.
* Keen attention to detail.
* Ability to work in a team environment.

title: Part-Time Building Maintenance Technician
description:
**Job Title: Maintenance Technician (Part-Time)**

**Location: Old Bridge, NJ**

We currently have an opportunity for a Part-Time Maintenance Technician at our medical office building in Old Bridge, New Jersey. This position will serve as the face of the company with the tenants at the property and is responsible for the day-to-day repairs and maintenance of the property.

.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to outdoor weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

title: Quality Control Specialist
description:
**Quality Control Specialist**

Founded in 2001, CSAV Systems has grown to be a leader in the professional Sound, Video & Teleconferencing industry. CSAV has serviced thousands of clients throughout the tristate area. We are innovators who design and provide commercial institutions with dynamic, user-friendly and cost-effective systems. We offer high quality professional Sound, Video & Teleconferencing systems for major clients in the following markets: healthcare, hospitality, Houses of Worship (Churches, Temples, etc.), corporate, retail, government, and more.

As a Quality Control Specialist, you will play a critical role in ensuring the highest level of quality and client satisfaction for all AV systems installed by our company. Your responsibilities will include:

* **Client Follow-Up**
* Contact clients, post-installation to schedule on-site visits.
* Schedule appointments and confirm details, including date, time, and purpose.
* **On-Site Visit and Quality Inspection**
* Prepare necessary documentation, and tools for inspections.
* Review client’s installation history and previous interactions.
* Conduct thorough system testing of all AV components (audio, video, control systems) to ensure proper functionality.
* Verify that wiring in AV racks, behind displays, in ceilings, and at devices is neat and properly secured.
* Ensure devices such as displays, cameras, and microphones are professionally installed, level, and in the proper location.
* Document and correct any issues related to neatness, wiring, or system functionality while on site.
* **Client Interaction**
* Collect client feedback using a standard questionnaire on system performance and satisfaction.
* Provide additional training if necessary
* Inquire about additional AV needs or future requirements.
* Request referrals and encourage clients to provide a Google review.
* **Documentation**
* Take high-quality photos of the installed AV systems for marketing purposes.
* Complete an inspection report detailing findings, actions taken, and client feedback.
* Submit the inspection report to Management and ensure proper filing.
* **Post-Visit Follow-Up**
* Send clients a copy of the inspection report and thank them for their time.
* Address any client requests or issues promptly and confirm resolution.
* **Internal Reporting**
* Brief relevant teams (engineering, sales, marketing) on additional client needs or potential opportunities.
* Provide photos and client testimonials to the marketing team.
* **Additional Responsibilities**
* Schedule on-site visits to measure new systems against Sales Orders.
* Record and report any nuances or errors in the system to the Tech Service Manager.
* Perform Level 1 Troubleshooting of system components as necessary.
* Regularly meet with the project manager and scheduling manager to keep an updated list of ongoing projects.
* Ensure any discrepancies in systems are corrected in a timely manner.
* Determine the cause of any system failures and report to Tech Services.
* Interface with clients to ensure their satisfaction with the system and promote more business.
* Keep detailed records of systems on file, including pictures, inventories, block diagrams, etc.

**Skillset Requirements**

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Quick and creative problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Keen attention to detail.
* Intermediate knowledge of audiovisual design/build.
* Basic audiovisual troubleshooting.
* Interpersonal skills with a friendly demeanor.

This role requires a proactive approach to maintaining high standards of quality and client satisfaction, ensuring that all installations are neat, clean, and professionally executed. You will play a vital part in our commitment to delivering high-quality AV solutions.

title: Sports Management Internship
description:
Need a Spring 2025 Internship? Apply Now!

USA Sport Group is at the forefront of providing high-quality sports enrichment programs to over 60,000 children annually. With classes and camps taking place in over 400 towns across NY, NJ & CT including preschool sports, soccer, tennis, basketball, t-ball, and more, we are always on the lookout for great people to join our team.

As a USA Sport Group Intern, you will gain hands-on work experience at an exciting, fast-paced, sports company. USA Sport Group internships can provide you with college course credits (depending on school requirements), or simply provide necessary work experience to prepare you for your future career.

The Sports Management Internship is designed for students studying or those aspiring towards a career in sports management, business management, communication, event planning, or relationship management. Students will gain knowledge and experience in client relations, business expansion, marketing, communications, program & event preparation and more.

You will work under the guidance of our Program & Client Managers to provide excellent day-to-day customer service to existing clients, including but not limited to Recreation Directors and Club Managers. You will liaise with these clients to collect program information and will provide them with personalized marketing materials. You will also have the opportunity to assist in creating client proposals and contracts.

Part of your experience will include assisting in the operations and logistics of sports camps and programs, including the planning and scheduling of coaching staff and resources required to successfully run a program. Other responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Assist the advertising of sports camps and classes to prospective customers
* Conduct research into areas of business expansions and sales
* Monitor and ensure correct tracking of client operations into dashboard
* Assist customers with registrations via phone and live chat

Does this sound like you?

* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Good organizational skills & attention to detail
* Flexibility and willingness to take on diverse roles and responsibilities
* Ability to deliver company philosophy and uphold customer service standards
* Clear and friendly phone manner
* Computer literate - especially Microsoft Office programs including Excel and Outlook
* Ability to multi-task in a pressurized environment
* Good communication skills both verbally and in written
* An interest or passion for sports
* Currently enrolled in a college institution or relevant experience is preferred

Flexible Internships Available

* Base internship of 15 hours per week
* Internships will be fully onsite in Whitehouse Station, NJ
* Customizable hours based around your studies
* Customizable to earn course credits

With a commitment to excellence and integrity, we cater to a high-end clientele seeking high-quality discrete experience. title: Patient Experience Representative
description:
**About the Company**



CardioOne partners with independent cardiologists to provide innovative solutions that improve patient outcomes and reduce costs. Our platform helps our physician partners thrive in today's fee-for-service environment and prepare for success in value-based care. In February 2024, we partnered with WindRose Health Investors as well as top physician services and payor executives to grow our team and invest in our next phase of growth.



CardioOne offers a magnificent work environment, good working conditions, and competitive pay. We offer medical, dental, vision, and a 401k plan with a match to benefit eligible employees. We offer PTO (Personal Time Off) and sick time to full-time employees. We take pride in creating a culture of employee engagement that translates into an exemplary patient experience. Join us in our mission to positively impact US cardiology.


**About the Role**



The Patient Experience Associate/Front Desk Receptionist serves as the first point of contact for patients and visitors, providing exceptional customer service and administrative support to ensure the smooth operation of the office. You will be responsible for managing appointments, coordinating patient inquiries, maintaining accurate records, and assisting in various administrative tasks.



This position is full-time and requires being onsite at **43 Yawpo Avenue, Suite 6, Oakland, NJ 07436.**


**Schedule:** Monday through Friday, no weekends, 7:30AM to 4:00 PM.


**Compensation**: $20 per hour.


**What you'll do:**


* **Greeting and Check-In:** Warmly greet patients and visitors as they arrive at the office. Assist with the check-in process, verifying patient information and insurance details.
* **Appointment Scheduling**: Manage the appointment calendar using scheduling software, ensuring optimal time utilization and minimizing patient wait times. Coordinate appointments for new and returning patients, as well as reschedule or cancel appointments when necessary.
* **Phone and Email Communication**: Answer incoming phone calls and respond to emails in a courteous and professional manner. Address patient inquiries, provide information about services, and assist with prescription refill requests.
* **Patient Registration:** Collect and update patient demographic and insurance information accurately. Verify insurance coverage and ensure necessary documentation is complete.
* **Medical Records Management:** Maintain and update patient records, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality. Organize and file medical documents, test results, and correspondence.
* **Waiting Area Management**: Keep the waiting area clean and organized, ensuring patients are comfortable while waiting. Provide reading materials or entertainment options as appropriate.
* **Patient Flow Coordination**: Monitor the flow of patients in the waiting area and inform medical staff of any delays or emergencies.
* **Office Supplies and Inventory:** Monitor and order office supplies, ensuring that essential items are stocked. Keep track of inventory and assist in maintaining a tidy and organized office environment.
* **Data Entry and Filing:** Enter patient information, appointments, and other relevant data into the office's electronic health records (EHR) system. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records.
* **Team Collaboration**: Work closely with medical staff, nurses, and other administrative personnel to ensure a seamless patient experience. Communicate relevant patient information and special requests.
* **Confidentiality:** Maintain patient confidentiality and adhere to privacy regulations, such as HIPAA.
* **Problem Solving:** Handle patient concerns and complaints in a professional and empathetic manner. Escalate complex issues to the appropriate personnel.


**What you'll need:**


* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or medical office certification is a plus.
* Proven experience as a receptionist or in a customer service role, preferably in a healthcare setting.
* Experience with insurance eligibility verification and collecting patient payments.
* Familiarity with medical terminology and procedures.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Proficiency in using scheduling software, electronic health records (EHR) systems, and basic office software (e.g., Microsoft Office).
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to multitask and handle a fast-paced environment.
* Empathetic and patient-focused approach.
* Professional appearance and demeanor.

title: Operations & Logistics Internship
description:
Need a Spring 2025 Internship? Apply Now!

USA Sport Group is at the forefront of providing high-quality sports enrichment programs to over 60,000 children annually. With classes and camps taking place in over 400 towns across NY, NJ & CT including preschool sports, soccer, tennis, basketball, t-ball, and more, we are always on the lookout for great people to join our team.

As a USA Sport Group Intern, you will gain hands-on work experience at an exciting, fast-paced, sports company. USA Sport Group internships can provide you with college course credits (depending on school requirements), or simply provide necessary work experience to prepare you for your future career.

The Business Operations & Logistics Internship is designed for currently enrolled students studying or aspiring towards a career in operations, business administration, logistics, and/or scheduling. Students will gain knowledge and experience in planning, and high-volume scheduling.

You will work under the guidance of the Operations Director to schedule and prepare coaching staff to deliver sports camps and classes to thousands of children. You will assist the team with day-to-day operations, where you will learn to think quickly, problem solve, and implement minute-by-minute logistical solutions.

Part of your experience will include communicating with coaching staff and updating employee profiles with information, including work availability, equipment logistics, pre-program preparation, post program feedback, session changes, and more. Other responsibilities will include but are not limited to

* Work within the coaching schedule to find errors and potential issues
* Use excel spreadsheets to input schedule assignments.
* Assist customers with their registration via phone and live chat.

Does this sound like you?

* Good organizational skills & attention to detail
* Critical thinking and problem-solving skills
* Proficiency in Excel to an intermediate level is desirable
* Flexibility and willingness to take on diverse roles and responsibilities
* Ability to deliver company philosophy and uphold customer service standards
* Clear and friendly phone manner
* Computer literate - especially Microsoft Office programs including Excel and Outlook
* Ability to multi-task in a pressurized environment
* Good communication skills both verbally and in written
* An interest or passion for sports

Flexible Internships Available

* Base internship of 15 hours per week
* Internships will be fully onsite in Whitehouse Station, NJ
* Customizable hours based around your studies
* Customizable to earn course credits

Job Type: Internship

Pay: $10.00 per day

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Work Location: On the road

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
Nibav Lifts Inc. is a global leader in home mobility solutions, specializing in cutting-edge pneumatic vacuum elevators. We are committed to revolutionizing the way people move within their homes, offering luxury and convenience. Join our passionate and growing team, and be part of a company that’s shaping the future of home mobility!
  
  

**Position Overview:**  

We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Warehouse Associate to join our high-energy team. As a Warehouse Associate, you will play a crucial role in managing the day-to-day operations of our warehouse, ensuring products are received, processed, and shipped out efficiently. This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys hands-on work.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Order Processing: Accurately pick, pack, and prepare customer orders for shipment while maintaining high standards of quality and timeliness.
* Inventory Control: Assist in inventory management by tracking stock levels, conducting regular cycle counts, and ensuring products are stored in an organized manner.
* Shipping & Receiving: Manage the receiving of inbound shipments, inspect for quality, verify accuracy, and ensure items are correctly documented and stored.
* Warehouse Organization: Keep the warehouse clean, organized, and safe by adhering to safety standards and implementing best practices in warehouse management.
* Product Handling: Safely handle and transport products within the warehouse, ensuring items are correctly placed and protected from damage.
* Team Collaboration: Work closely with team members to ensure smooth warehouse operations and excellent customer service.
* Equipment Usage: Operate forklifts, pallet jacks, and other equipment (training and certification can be provided).


**Qualifications:**  

* High school diploma or equivalent required.
* Previous experience in warehouse or distribution environments is a plus.
* Ability to lift and move packages weighing up to 50 lbs.
* Excellent attention to detail with a focus on accuracy in order processing.
* Basic computer skills for inventory management and order tracking.
* Strong time management and organizational skills.
* Positive attitude and the ability to work well within a team.
* Forklift experience or certification is an asset (willingness to obtain certification if not already certified).


**What We Offer:**  

* Competitive pay with opportunities for overtime.
* Full health benefits, including medical, dental, and vision coverage.
* Paid time off, including holidays and personal days.
* Career advancement opportunities in a growing company.
* On-the-job training and certification opportunities.
* A positive, team-focused environment where your contributions are valued

title: Film Study Instructor (Part Time)
description:
Job Summary
  
The Film Study Instructor at Concorde Education is responsible for guiding students through the exploration of film as an art form and a medium of communication. This role involves covering major topics in film studies, providing exemplars for different topics, and curating clips to illustrate key points. The instructor will develop and implement a curriculum that deepens students' understanding of film history, theory, genres, and technical aspects. The expected impact includes enhanced critical thinking, media literacy, and appreciation for the cinematic arts among students.
  
General Responsibilities
  
* Design and implement a film study curriculum tailored to the needs and interests of the students.
* Lead film study sessions that teach students about film history, theory, genres, and technical aspects.
* Foster a safe, respectful, and engaging learning environment.
* Assess students' skills and provide constructive feedback.
* Collaborate with other instructors and program coordinators to integrate the film study curriculum with other educational offerings.
* Track student progress and maintain accurate records.
* Facilitate regular communication with parents, guardians, and educational stakeholders regarding student performance and program updates.
* Ensure that all equipment and materials are properly set up, maintained, and stored.


Major Duties
  
* Curriculum Development: Develop lesson plans and learning modules that cover major topics in film studies, including history, theory, genres, and technical aspects.
* Classroom Instruction: Lead classes, ensuring that each student is actively engaged and benefiting from the educational experience.
* Student Assessment: Regularly evaluate student progress, adapting instruction to meet individual needs.
* Community Building: Create a classroom environment that encourages critical discussion, respect, and appreciation for diverse cinematic perspectives.
* Technology and Equipment Management: Ensure the optimal performance and maintenance of all audiovisual equipment and film materials.
* Documentation and Reporting: Keep accurate records of student attendance, assessment results, and feedback, submitting reports as required.


Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities
  
* Instructional Skills: Ability to design and implement a curriculum that is age-appropriate, engaging, and educational.
* Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with students, parents, and staff.
* Interpersonal Skills: Excellent teamwork and collaboration abilities. Must be open to receiving feedback and making adjustments accordingly.
* Organizational Skills: Must be able to manage time effectively, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
* Content Knowledge: Must have extensive knowledge of film studies, including history, theory, genres, and technical aspects.

title: Hospice Social Worker
description:
Serenity Hospice provides caring and compassionate hospice care services to patients and families throughout New Jersey. Our mission is to alleviate pain and symptoms; foster a state of calmness and harmony; and encourage an appreciation of family, friends, and life experiences.

**Serenity Hospice Care** is looking for compassionate and dedicated **Social Worker** to join our team! This position will be responsible for performing the social services section of the assessment process as well as provide on-going care to patients and their families.

**Responsibilities:**

* Managing and completing all psych-social assessments
* Educating the patient and family about services
* Managing financial information from patients and family
* With the interdisciplinary team, develop a plan of care.
* Assist the patient and family with difficulties (personal, financial, environmental)
* Collaborate with the team to manage any ongoing issues
* Assess and reassess ongoing social, emotional and financial factors for the patient and family
* Identify and promote community and family resources to assist with the patients plan of care
* Develop, prepare and maintain clinical documentation with accuracy, and on time according to the prescribed policies

**Requirements:**

* Hold a valid MSW from an accredited university.
* 1 Year of Hospice Experience
* Reliable Transportation & Willing to Travel
* Have working knowledge of territory
* Self-Managed; Independent
* Organized

**What We Offer:**

Monday - Friday Work Schedule (8:30 AM to 4:30 PM)

No Nights or Weekends required.

We offer a competitive salary based on experience and a generous benefit package including Health, Dental, Matched 401(k) and PTO Days.

*Serenity Hospice Care provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.*

title: Executive Assistant
description:
We are an American luxury lifestyle brand, founded in 2004. Anchored in the casual elegance of American sportswear, Tory’s design philosophy is defined by effortless silhouettes, innovative materials, eclectic juxtapositions of color, and the tension of past and present. The collections include ready-to-wear, handbags, footwear, accessories, jewelry, home and beauty.
Empowering women is the company’s guiding principle, expressed through Tory’s collections and reflected in the company culture as well as the work of the Tory Burch Foundation. Established in 2009, the Foundation provides women entrepreneurs in the United States with capital, education and community.
You are seeking a work environment where people are encouraged to dream, explore, discover and, as important, laugh together. If you’re prepared to work hard, create impact, and have fun while doing it, we would love to have you join #TeamTory. Apply today!
Life @ToryBurch is Special Because:
When you join us, you’re joining a global, purpose-led company on an exciting growth journey with an amazing culture and great benefits.
Our culture is welcoming and inclusive * - everyone is empowered to make a difference.
* We have the best team in the world and believe in paying competitively and rewarding for high performance.
* Your overall well-being is important to us; we offer generous benefits to help you take care of your mental and physical health, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life.
* We love seeing our employees wear our beautiful collections. You’ll receive a generous employee discount and access to exclusive sample sales.
* We are invested in your professional growth – you’ll have access to free executive coaching on-demand.
* We believe in the importance of giving back and you’ll have many opportunities to do just that through the Tory Burch Foundation and paid volunteer days.


This Role is Tailor-Made for You Because:
You are able to manage highly confidential information and can interact professionally with high-level executives on a regular basis. You have strong attention to detail, are highly organized, and can multi-task and prioritize all tasks. You are polished and professional and have grace under pressure. You have strong verbal and written communication skills with an ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You are proactive with excellent follow-up skills and are extremely resourceful and self-driven. You can work independently as well as part of a team- a sense of humor is a plus!
A Day in the Life:* Maintain calendar for the executive and their direct reports- prioritizing appointments and proactively resolving scheduling conflicts throughout the day to ensure attendance and punctuality at meetings
* Makes travel arrangements including booking flights, hotel accommodations, car services, and manage travel agendas
* Enter and track expenses
* Proactively manage the needs of the team, prioritizing what is important and urgent
* Responds to phone, email and in-person inquiries – providing general information and directing inquiries to correct source or point of contact
* Manage all necessary arrangements for internal and external meeting planning including sending invitations, booking rooms and arranging catering
* Organizes special events as required including team off-sites and larger cross-functional team meetings
* Work closely with the other assistants to schedule inter – department meetings with executives
* Work on special projects which may include presentation creation using Excel and/or PowerPoint and finalization of presentations and other documents
* Ad hoc personal requests


To Land This Role:* BA/BS or equivalent work experience
* Minimum of 6+ years of relevant work experience
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Office
* Must have a customer service orientation
* Exceptional interpersonal communication and organization skills, strong attention to detail, strong writing skills, problem – solver, demonstrated ability to interact with Senior Management
* A high sense of urgency, timeliness and follow-through


Why You'll Want to Join Our Team:
We’re a tight-knit, collaborative group of Executive Assistants working closely together and with our global teams and others to ensure that our executives are supported. It’s an exciting opportunity for a well-organized multitasker who thrives in a fast-paced environment and whose meticulous attention to detail is balanced by a sense of fun. Come join us!
How We Work Together* Adaptable – We change before we have to
* Entrepreneurial – We own it
* Collaborative – There’s no “I” in Tory
* Client & Brand Focused – We put ourselves in Tory’s shoes
* Live the Values – We show up for each other
* Functional Expertise – We’re constantly learning and growing


#TeamTory Values
We show up with honesty & kindness, act with integrity & compassion, work with passion & humility and lead with excellence & humor.
Compensation Range
The compensation range for this position is 85,000.00 USD - 120,000.00 USD. Our offer will be based on your relevant experience and work location.
Benefits Information
We offer a generous set of benefits to help you take care of your heath, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life. Here are highlights of key benefits available to all Tory Burch members that work over 30 hours.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Tory Burch LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to an individual’s age, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex (including pregnancy) or sexual orientation, gender expression, military status, marital status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, disability or membership in any other protected class under applicable law. Likewise, we will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Ordinance No. 184652. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.
Disability Accommodation
Tory Burch is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require assistance or an accommodation with the hiring process, please contact thetalentteam@toryburch.com.

title: Registered Nurse
company: FirstLight Home Care of Western Essex County, NJ
description:
**Registered Nurse - Per-Diem** 

**Western Essex County, NJ**

At FirstLight Home Care, we're on a mission to ensure that every adult experiences comfort, dignity, and independence in the familiarity of their own home, each and every day. As a PRN, you will conduct initial client evaluations, develop Service Plans/Care Plans, and supervise visits. You will make management and budget decisions, coordinate meetings, and lead a team of healthcare professionals. This position is vital in ensuring high-quality care and client satisfaction. Your dedication to providing exceptional care, tailored to the unique needs of our clients, brings peace of mind to their families. We cherish passion and dedication, guided by our core values: Focus on Relationships First, Act with Integrity, Give Joy, Grow Together, and Make a Difference Every Day.

**Position Type:** Part-Time, Flexible hours scheduled at your convenience. Minimum of 5 hours per week.

**Wage Range: $43.00 - $47.00/hr** 

**Job Relationships:**

* Supervised by: Administrator
* Workers Supervised: RN, LPN, HHA, CNA

**Responsibilities:**

* Oversee client services and ensure client needs are met
* Conduct annual evaluations, maintain competencies, adhere to state regulations, and ensure accreditation compliance
* Coordinate services according to Service Plans/Care Plans
* Perform initial evaluation visits and regular reevaluations of client needs
* Initiate and revise Service Plans/Care Plans and physician orders as necessary
* Document client assessments, Care Plans, supervisory visits, caregiver and client education, and training
* Communicate changes in client condition and needs to personnel
* Implement nursing care plans and report changes in client condition to the appropriate parties
* Counsel clients and their families/significant others regarding service needs and related issues
* Participate in quality assurance reviews and evaluations
* Coordinate staff meetings, client care conferences, and in-services
* Supervise and educate team members
* Assist clients in learning self-care techniques

**Education/Experience:**

* Graduate of a state-approved school of nursing with current RN licensure
* Minimum of two (2) years' experience in home care
* At least one (1) year of supervisory experience preferred
* Proficient in Microsoft Office, Google Suite, and scheduling software

**Certifications, Licensure, & Registration:**

* Maintain current state RN licensure
* Possess a valid driver’s license and auto insurance

**Language Skills:**

* Ability to read, write, and effectively communicate in English
* Proficiency in written and verbal communication
* Ability to interpret documents such as instructions, correspondence, and regulations

**Reasoning Abilities:**

* Strong organizational and communication skills
* Ability to make complex decisions using critical thinking and reasoning
* Capability to manage high-stress situations effectively

**Physical Demands & Work Environment:**

* Must be able to lift and move up to 50 pounds
* Work environment includes both office settings and clients' homes
* Potential exposure to illness and body fluids
* Moderate noise levels in the work environment

title: Computer Repair Technician
description:
Revivn is a profitable and rapidly growing company that helps enterprises manage their technology through our end of life software platform. We take electronic recycling one step further by repurposing hardware that still has remaining life and providing it to people who lack dedicated computer access and make it more affordable for people who may not be able to purchase new technology. Working with companies like Instacart, Lyft, Qualtrics, X, Gensler, and Allbirds we are changing the way companies view used technology with a new model that focuses on repurposing instead of recycling.  


As a Revivn technician you will provide hardware diagnostics and repair on computer desktops, laptops, printers and server equipment. We are seeking an individual with some experience working with electronics (desktops, laptops, etc..) who are willing to take charge and thrive in a challenging and fast paced environment.  


What Revivn offers you:  


Full exposure to the logistical and mechanical operations of a tech startup  
Ownership in assessing technology, repurposing hardware, and streamlining processes  
Potential for advancement from an entry level technician to advance repairs and other operation roles with on job training  


In this role you will:  


Assess conditions of incoming electronics  
Install and configure hardware, software, and peripherals  
Technically inspect, classify, sort, disassemble and repair computer hardware  
Record configuration, repairs performed and cosmetic information in the Revivn inventory system  


We're ideally seeking:  


Focus on data accuracy and production quality  
Knowledge of different computer operating systems and hardware  
Knowledge of Apple and Microsoft applications and operating systems  
Knowledge of BIOS configuration and upgrade utilities  
Ability to identify and install both PC and Apple hardware/peripherals  
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and dependable  
If this sounds like you, apply! If you don't meet all of the qualifications but think you could be a match, we'd still love the chance to review your application.  


We embrace diversity and are committed to fostering an inclusive environment. At Revivn, we encourage people from all ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Revivn does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  


The salary for a Computer Repair Technician is $19/hr.  


Pay: $19.00 per hour

JP Express Service Inc. is a non-union LTL motor freight carrier with 5 locations in the Tri-State area. JP Express Service is privately owned with approximately 265 employees and has been doing business since 1992.

* We believe in the importance of giving back and you’ll have many opportunities to do just that through the Tory Burch Foundation and paid volunteer days.


This Role is Tailor-Made for You Because:
You are committed to end-user satisfaction and technical/operational stability throughout our end user community. You enjoy supporting the computing needs of the organization and have excellent interpersonal skills with a willingness to embrace our culture. You are resourceful with great time-management skills and can thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment.  

A sense of humor is a plus!
A Day in the Life:
The typical day is… atypical. You might be:* Providing Level 2 support to our client base (Corp/Retail) using our ticketing system (Zendesk)
	+ Maintaining and supporting various client technologies, such as workstation hardware and software, mobile device installations
	+ Helping to identify and proactively solve problems
	+ Creating and updating support documentation (SOPs) where needed
* Supporting various meetings/company events with audio-visual needs, including set up and in-meeting support


The consistent thread is that you’ll be working with an amazing team of women and men who share your passion for excellence.  

To Land This Role:* 2+ years of experience with an emphasis on client support / end user experience
* Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or Information System or equivalent desirable degree
* Strong working knowledge of client technologies, such as:
	+ Windows 10, Mac OSX
	+ Mobile Device iOS and Management
	+ Microsoft Office Suite, including MS Teams
	+ LAN/Wireless LAN and various communication technologies
	+ Active Directory
* Very strong analytical approach to problem solving and solution development.
* Results-oriented troubleshooting and commitment to excellence.
* Understanding of customer needs and satisfaction by providing Executive Level support when needed (Windows/Mac)
* The ability to be self-sufficient and work both autonomously and as part of a team environment.
* Must be able to work closely with other skill teams and Lines of Business to understand requirements and deliver appropriate solutions.


Why You'll Want to Join Our Team:
Our Technology team has a clear mission: use technology to enable the business to operate efficiently while driving growth and profitability. We envision, we strategize, we engineer, we design, we build, we test, we support, and we serve. Our tools and systems impact every customer and every member of our team every day and our role is to make each engagement seamless and rewarding. As we build our in-house engineering teams, we are focused on further modernizing our platforms, leveraging our data analytics capabilities and creating a transformational customer experience. Come join us!
How We Work Together* Adaptable – We change before we have to
* Entrepreneurial – We own it
* Collaborative – There’s no “I” in Tory
* Client & Brand Focused – We put ourselves in Tory’s shoes
* Live the Values – We show up for each other
* Functional Expertise – We’re constantly learning and growing


#TeamTory Values
We show up with honesty & kindness, act with integrity & compassion, work with passion & humility and lead with excellence & humor.
Compensation Range
The compensation range for this position is 25.00 USD - 32.00 USD. Our offer will be based on your relevant experience and work location.
Benefits Information
We offer a generous set of benefits to help you take care of your heath, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life. Here are highlights of key benefits available to all Tory Burch members that work over 30 hours.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.

title: Designer, Ready-to-Wear
description:
We are an American luxury lifestyle brand, founded in 2004. Anchored in the casual elegance of American sportswear, Tory’s design philosophy is defined by effortless silhouettes, innovative materials, eclectic juxtapositions of color, and the tension of past and present. The collections include ready-to-wear, handbags, footwear, accessories, jewelry, home and beauty.
Empowering women is the company’s guiding principle, expressed through Tory’s collections and reflected in the company culture as well as the work of the Tory Burch Foundation. Established in 2009, the Foundation provides women entrepreneurs in the United States with capital, education and community.
You are seeking a work environment where people are encouraged to dream, explore, discover and, as important, laugh together. If you’re prepared to work hard, create impact, and have fun while doing it, we would love to have you join #TeamTory. Apply today!
Life @ToryBurch is Special Because:
When you join us, you’re joining a global, purpose-led company on an exciting growth journey with an amazing culture and great benefits.
Our culture is welcoming and inclusive * - everyone is empowered to make a difference.
* We have the best team in the world and believe in paying competitively and rewarding for high performance.
* Your overall well-being is important to us; we offer generous benefits to help you take care of your mental and physical health, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life.
* We love seeing our employees wear our beautiful collections. You’ll receive a generous employee discount and access to exclusive sample sales.
* We are invested in your professional growth – you’ll have access to free executive coaching on-demand.
* We believe in the importance of giving back and you’ll have many opportunities to do just that through the Tory Burch Foundation and paid volunteer days.


This Role is Tailor-Made for You Because:
You have experience designing knits and dresses for a luxury brand. You are creative, adaptable and enjoy coming up with new innovative silhouettes. You thrive on conceptualizing seasonal collections that seamlessly blend high fashion with commercial appeal, all while embodying the distinctive Tory Burch aesthetic.
A Day in the Life:
The Designer, Ready-to-Wear will work with the Design Director & Vice President to initiate concepts each season for the Tory Sport- Coming & Going apparel segment where they will collaborate with talented designers and cross-functional partners in the business.* Creates sketches and product prototypes throughout the conceptual design process
* Partners with Director to develop and refine seasonal concept, materials, and palette
* Ability to come up with new innovative silhouettes within the Tory Burch aesthetic for knitwear and dresses within the “coming & going” segment.
* Responsible for upholding design integrity, high quality execution, and timeliness throughout the entire development process from concept through engineering and commercialization
* Participates in meetings with cross-functional category partners
* Adhere to seasonal and time and action calendars, ensuring that the category meets deadlines


To Land This Role:* 5+ years of design experience with a focus on ready-to-wear/knitwear/dresses
* Degree in Fashion Design or equivalent work experience
* Must provide digital portfolio of work
* Strong taste level, research skills, ability to identify silhouettes, pattern and color within the Tory Burch aesthetic
* Strong hand sketching skills in addition to sketching technical drawings
* Ability to drape new, interesting silhouettes as well as creating interesting new finishings
* Strong working knowledge of Centric PLM, Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop, Microsoft Word and Excel
* Experience developing product directly with factories; understanding of development from concept through engineering
* Must be able to build all tech packs and pass specs in a detailed, organized and clear manner for factory proto sample making


Why You'll Want to Join Our Team:
Every style has a story and that story begins in Design. Our wildly creative team of dreamers and doers works together to bring Tory Burch’s unique vision to life. At every stage of the design process, our focus is on exciting our customer with pieces that are beautiful, timeless and exquisitely crafted. Along the way, we work with world class suppliers and artisans, and partner with premier mills and manufacturers to ensure that our designs meet our exacting standards for quality. If you want to be part of an empowered and innovative group of designers, come join us!
How We Work Together* Adaptable – We change before we have to
* Entrepreneurial – We own it
* Collaborative – There’s no “I” in Tory
* Client & Brand Focused – We put ourselves in Tory’s shoes
* Live the Values – We show up for each other
* Functional Expertise – We’re constantly learning and growing


#TeamTory Values
We show up with honesty & kindness, act with integrity & compassion, work with passion & humility and lead with excellence & humor.
Compensation Range
The compensation range for this position is 85,000.00 USD - 120,000.00 USD. Our offer will be based on your relevant experience and work location.
Benefits Information
We offer a generous set of benefits to help you take care of your heath, create financial security, and achieve wellness in all areas of your life. Here are highlights of key benefits available to all Tory Burch members that work over 30 hours.

title: Weekend Nanny Needed in Tribeca #493
description:
*A Nanny Match is a unique nanny placement service that matches warm, loving & highly qualified nannies with families through a customized placement process. We emphasize safety, compatibility, and a mindful matchmaking process.*

***Applicants must apply on our website to be considered for the position www.anannymatch.com/nannies/.*****If you have already been vetted by our agency, please do not apply to this job posting. Reach out to us directly with your interest.**An active, loving family of four in Tribeca, NYC, is seeking a weekend nanny to primarily care for their nearly 2.5-year-old child (g). The family just welcomed a newborn into the family! The nanny in this role will mainly care for the eldest child until the baby is a little older.

The general schedule is **Saturdays and Sundays from 10am to 6pm.**

The family can guarantee **3 weekends per month.** The weekends will be planned at least one month in advance.

There will be some occasional weekend travel to their home in the Hamptons.

The position starts as soon as possible.

**The Ideal Candidate:**

* Energetic, warm, engaging, proactive, safety-conscious, and responsible.
* At least 2 years of nanny experience with toddlers and infants.
* Flexible with the schedule (weekends).
* Seeking a long-term weekend position.

**Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:**

* Actively engaging the child in educational and fun age-appropriate activities.
* Supporting the achievement of age-appropriate milestones (e.g. mealtime, socialization, potty training, learning to read).
* Taking the child to classes, the park, and playdates.
* Maintaining the child’s nap and eating schedules.
* Children's laundry.
* Meal preparation for the child.
* Keeping the home's main spaces and the child’s room clean and tidy.

**Requirements:**

* 2+ years of relevant nanny experience with infants and toddlers.
* Legally permitted to work in the U.S.
* 2-3 relevant references.
* Resides within a reasonable commuting distance from Tribeca.
* Must like dogs. The family has an adorable Bernedoodle.

**Compensation**: The hourly rate starts at $30.00 per hour or higher depending on the right candidate's experience and credentials.

**Benefits:** 2-3 days of sick leave per year, paid holidays that land on a regularly scheduled work day, and other benefits such as a monthly metro card reimbursement can be negotiable.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $30.00 - $35.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends only

Application Question(s):

* Do you understand that you must apply on our website to be considered for the position?
* Are you able to commit to one year?
* Are you comfortable with a dog in the home?

Experience:

* nanny: 2 years (Required)
* infant/toddler: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person
